entry.title: Movie: Black Swan, starring Natalie Portman (2011)
entry.content:
Movie: Black Swan, starring Natalie Portman (2011)20150305
I like the ballet in this movie. I do feel like they play the
ballerinas too close to the stereotype though.

This is a CRAZY movie. They do a great of job of upping the
insanity in the character!
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Book: The Great Gatsby, by F. Scott Fitzgerald (1925)
entry.content:
Book: The Great Gatsby, by F. Scott Fitzgerald (1925)20150305
I liked the movie version that recently came out of this, so I
decided to read the book. I'm kind of amazed how closely the movie
followed the book. So far, I feel like there's very little reason
to prefer the book over the movie, as far as getting the big
picture and the essence of the message.

I finished the book in one day. It is a good tragedy.
  • Books
  • 1925

entry.title: Book: The Tipping Point, by Malcolm Gladwell (2000) (2)
entry.content:
Book: The Tipping Point, by Malcolm Gladwell (2000) (2)20150303
I finished this book while on a flight. Lots of neat examples. I
liked the stuff about kids TV shows a lot.
  • Books
  • 2000

entry.title: Movie: Knocked Up, starring Seth Rogen (2007)
entry.content:
Movie: Knocked Up, starring Seth Rogen (2007)20150303
This was a super cute movie. It was fun to see most of the same
people from other Rogen/Apatow movies. Katherine Heigl is super
cute.
  • Movies
  • 2007

entry.title: Movie: Ephraim's Rescue, directed by T. C. Christensen (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Ephraim's Rescue, directed by T. C. Christensen (2013)20150302
This was a very interesting movie. The handcart parts were the
best, but I think they could have been better. I would've liked to
see the testimonies of the people more and the scene with Brigham
Young in conference. It couldn't really work because it was told
from Ephraim's perspective. Some of the acting was really bad and
some of the dramatic moments were poorly shot so you couldn't
really tell that the person was really in danger. Overall, it was
okay.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: The Iron Lady, starring Meryl Streep (2011)
entry.content:
Movie: The Iron Lady, starring Meryl Streep (2011)20150301
I was very interested in learning about Margaret Thatcher, but I
feel like this movie went too quickly over her life. I was hoping
and expecting that the "now" scenes would end quickly and we'd see
a coherent story of her life, but that didn't happen. I suppose it
is "important" to depict the life of people with dementia, but I
would much rather see her rise to power and glory in her
accomplishments.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Game: Super Mario 3D World (WiiU, 2013) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario 3D World (WiiU, 2013) (5)20150228

entry.title: Movie: Moonrise Kingdom, directed by Wes Anderson (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: Moonrise Kingdom, directed by Wes Anderson (2012)20150228
This was an amazing and super cute movie. It is so odd but feels so
authentic at the same time. I really loved it. My wife and I smiled
and giggled at so many moments.

entry.content:

entry.title: Game: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds (3DS, 2013) (5)
entry.content:
Game: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds (3DS, 2013) (5)20150225
I played for another hour today and worked on exploring Lorule. I
still haven't got through any of the Sage dungeons. I'm really
blown away by how hard it is to get started and get inside some of
the dungeons. This game is so much similar to LttP, it's crazy.

Total time: 5:34
  • Video Games
  • The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds
  • 3DS
  • 2013

entry.title: Book: The Drawing of the Three, by Stephen King (1987)
entry.content:
Book: The Drawing of the Three, by Stephen King (1987)20150225
I've been reading this recently on flights. It is REALLY weird,
especially compared to the more straight post-apocalyptic fantasy
of the first one. I know the last book had the vision of Jake in
the real-world, but this is really crazy. I'm especially freaked
out by what is actually going to happen... can you really have an
adventure where the heroes are missing fingers, toes, and legs and
where they have no more bullets? What is the Tower? I wish we knew
why Roland cared.

My main dislike of the book is that it seems to try and gross out
the reader for the sake of the gross out. It's like he tried to
think of the most disgusting and reprehensible things just
because. I really don't like that.
  • Books
  • 1987

entry.content:

entry.title: Movie: Big Hero 6, starring Scott Adsit (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: Big Hero 6, starring Scott Adsit (2014)20150221
This was a fun movie that we watched as a family. The kids really
liked it and found it just the right amount of exciting and
relaxing. I thought the story was pretty neat and I really
appreciated how they tried to push "science" as a good thing for
kids.

entry.title: Movie: About Time, starring Domhnall Gleeson (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: About Time, starring Domhnall Gleeson (2013)20150219
Insanely cute! This was a very nice movie. I like the decision he
comes to about his life and what he wants to do with it. It makes
me want to be better for my family.

entry.title: Movie: The World's End, starring Simon Pegg (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The World's End, starring Simon Pegg (2013)20150219
It's interesting that Simon is the screw-up in this one. It took a
LONG time for the true plot to come out. It was getting
depressing. Another movie with Rosamund! This was pretty silly and
the end was much more bombastic than I thought it would be.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: This is the End, starring Jay Baruchel (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: This is the End, starring Jay Baruchel (2013)20150219
I like the way they establish that they are not "acting". The way
the Rapture happens was hilarious. Emma Watson! This movie is so
dumb but so funny too. All the Channing Tatum stuff is super
ridiculous. The ending was hilarious. Both that there was a giant
Lucifer and that the Backstreet Brothers singing was the punch
line.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds (3DS, 2013) (2)
entry.content:
Game: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds (3DS, 2013) (2)20150217
I played this for a bit. I finished the first two dungeons and did
a lot of exploration. It is pretty fun and I'm surprised how
opaque it is, compared to the simplicity of recent Zelda games. I
like it a lot.

Total time: 2:37
